subject: Re: [junit] REQ: Pro side of "use inner classes to test  private stuff"

messageBody:
>So said Alain Ravet on 2003-08-06 --------------------
>J. B. Rainsberger wrote:
>
>>I am looking for opinions on the pro side of using inner classes to test
>the private parts of a class.
>
>I know it's a little OT, but what may justify testing private methods?
>Anybody has got a real-life example of such a case?

The most common real-life scenario for me has to do with refactoring legacy code. I need tests before I can refactor. If a component is not designed to be tested, then I may need to reach into its bowels to write the tests I need to start refactoring.

I don't have a real-life example at hand, though.
